InstanceInterruptionBehavior.documentation: The behavior when a Spot Instance is interrupted. The default is terminate.

AllocationStrategy.documentation: Indicates how to allocate the target capacity across the Spot pools specified by the Spot Fleet request. The default is lowest-price.

InstanceInterruptionBehavior.documentation: The behavior when a Spot Instance is interrupted. The default is terminate.

InstancePoolsToUseCount.documentation: The number of Spot pools across which to allocate your target Spot capacity. Valid only when AllocationStrategy is set to lowestPrice. EC2 Fleet selects the cheapest Spot pools and evenly allocates your target Spot capacity across the number of Spot pools that you specify.

SpotOptions.documentation: Describes the configuration of Spot Instances in an EC2 Fleet.

AllocationStrategy.documentation: Indicates how to allocate the target capacity across the Spot pools specified by the Spot Fleet request. The default is lowestPrice.

InstanceInterruptionBehavior.documentation: The behavior when a Spot Instance is interrupted. The default is terminate.

InstancePoolsToUseCount.documentation: The number of Spot pools across which to allocate your target Spot capacity. Valid only when Spot AllocationStrategy is set to lowest-price. EC2 Fleet selects the cheapest Spot pools and evenly allocates your target Spot capacity across the number of Spot pools that you specify.

SpotOptionsRequest.documentation: Describes the configuration of Spot Instances in an EC2 Fleet request.

AvailabilityZone.documentation:
The Availability Zone.

[Spot Fleet only] To specify multiple Availability Zones, separate them using commas; for example, "us-west-2a, us-west-2b".

GroupName.documentation: The name of the placement group.

Tenancy.documentation: The tenancy of the instance (if the instance is running in a VPC). An instance with a tenancy of dedicated runs on single-tenant hardware. The host tenancy is not supported for Spot Instances.

AvailabilityZone.documentation: The Availability Zone.

InstanceType.documentation: The instance type.

SpotPrice.documentation: The maximum price per hour that you are willing to pay for a Spot Instance.

Timestamp.documentation: The date and time the request was created, in UTC format (for example, YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ).

SpotPrice.documentation: Describes the maximum price per hour that you are willing to pay for a Spot Instance.

FromPort.documentation: The start of the port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP type number. A value of -1 indicates all ICMP types.

IpProtocol.documentation: The IP protocol name (for tcp, udp, and icmp) or number (see Protocol Numbers).

IpRanges.documentation: One or more IP ranges. Not applicable for stale security group rules.

PrefixListIds.documentation: One or more prefix list IDs for an AWS service. Not applicable for stale security group rules.

ToPort.documentation: The end of the port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP type number. A value of -1 indicates all ICMP types.

UserIdGroupPairs.documentation: One or more security group pairs. Returns the ID of the referenced security group and VPC, and the ID and status of the VPC peering connection.

StaleIpPermission.documentation: Describes a stale rule in a security group.

GroupName.documentation: The name of the security group.

StaleIpPermissions.documentation: Information about the stale inbound rules in the security group.

StaleIpPermissionsEgress.documentation: Information about the stale outbound rules in the security group.

VpcId.documentation: The ID of the VPC for the security group.

StaleSecurityGroup.documentation: Describes a stale security group (a security group that contains stale rules).

DryRun.documentation: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation. Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

StartingInstances.documentation: Information about one or more started instances.

Code.documentation: The reason code for the state change.

Message.documentation:
The message for the state change.

  • Server.InsufficientInstanceCapacity: There was insufficient capacity available to satisfy the launch request.

  • Server.InternalError: An internal error caused the instance to terminate during launch.

  • Server.ScheduledStop: The instance was stopped due to a scheduled retirement.

  • Server.SpotInstanceShutdown: The instance was stopped because the number of Spot requests with a maximum price equal to or higher than the Spot price exceeded available capacity or because of an increase in the Spot price.

  • Server.SpotInstanceTermination: The instance was terminated because the number of Spot requests with a maximum price equal to or higher than the Spot price exceeded available capacity or because of an increase in the Spot price.

  • Client.InstanceInitiatedShutdown: The instance was shut down using the shutdown -h command from the instance.

  • Client.InstanceTerminated: The instance was terminated or rebooted during AMI creation.

  • Client.InternalError: A client error caused the instance to terminate during launch.

  • Client.InvalidSnapshot.NotFound: The specified snapshot was not found.

  • Client.UserInitiatedShutdown: The instance was shut down using the Amazon EC2 API.

  • Client.VolumeLimitExceeded: The limit on the number of EBS volumes or total storage was exceeded. Decrease usage or request an increase in your account limits.

DryRun.documentation: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation. Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

Force.documentation:
Forces the instances to stop. The instances do not have an opportunity to flush file system caches or file system metadata. If you use this option, you must perform file system check and repair procedures. This option is not recommended for Windows instances.

Default: false

StoppingInstances.documentation: Information about one or more stopped instances.

Storage.documentation: Describes the storage location for an instance store-backed AMI.

StorageLocation.documentation: Describes a storage location in Amazon S3.

AvailabilityZone.documentation: The Availability Zone of the subnet.

AvailableIpAddressCount.documentation: The number of unused private IPv4 addresses in the subnet. The IPv4 addresses for any stopped instances are considered unavailable.

CidrBlock.documentation: The IPv4 CIDR block assigned to the subnet.

DefaultForAz.documentation: Indicates whether this is the default subnet for the Availability Zone.

MapPublicIpOnLaunch.documentation: Indicates whether instances launched in this subnet receive a public IPv4 address.

SubnetId.documentation: The ID of the subnet.

VpcId.documentation: The ID of the VPC the subnet is in.

AssignIpv6AddressOnCreation.documentation: Indicates whether a network interface created in this subnet (including a network interface created by RunInstances) receives an IPv6 address.

Ipv6CidrBlockAssociationSet.documentation: Information about the IPv6 CIDR blocks associated with the subnet.

StatusMessage.documentation: A message about the status of the CIDR block, if applicable.

SubnetCidrBlockState.documentation: Describes the state of a CIDR block.

AssociationId.documentation: The association ID for the CIDR block.

Ipv6CidrBlockState.documentation: Information about the state of the CIDR block.

SubnetIpv6CidrBlockAssociation.documentation: Describes an IPv6 CIDR block associated with a subnet.

SuccessfulInstanceCreditSpecificationIte.documentation: Describes the T2 or T3 instance whose credit option for CPU usage was successfully modified.

Key.documentation:
The key of the tag.

Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:.

Value.documentation:
The value of the tag.

Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 255 Unicode characters.

ResourceType.documentation: The type of resource to tag. Currently, the resource types that support tagging on creation are fleet, dedicated-host, instance, snapshot, and volume. To tag a resource after it has been created, see CreateTags.

Tags.documentation: The tags to apply to the resource.

TagSpecification.documentation: The tags to apply to a resource when the resource is being created.

TotalTargetCapacity.documentation: The number of units to request, filled using DefaultTargetCapacityType.

OnDemandTargetCapacity.documentation: The number of On-Demand units to request.

SpotTargetCapacity.documentation: The maximum number of Spot units to launch.

TargetCapacitySpecification.documentation: The number of units to request. You can choose to set the target capacity in terms of instances or a performance characteristic that is important to your application workload, such as vCPUs, memory, or I/O. If the request type is maintain, you can specify a target capacity of 0 and add capacity later.

TotalTargetCapacity.documentation: The number of units to request, filled using DefaultTargetCapacityType.

OnDemandTargetCapacity.documentation: The number of On-Demand units to request.

SpotTargetCapacity.documentation: The number of Spot units to request.

TargetCapacitySpecificationRequest.documentation: The number of units to request. You can choose to set the target capacity in terms of instances or a performance characteristic that is important to your application workload, such as vCPUs, memory, or I/O. If the request type is maintain, you can specify a target capacity of 0 and add capacity later.

InstanceCount.documentation: The number of instances the Convertible Reserved Instance offering can be applied to. This parameter is reserved and cannot be specified in a request

OfferingId.documentation: The ID of the Convertible Reserved Instance offering.

TargetConfiguration.documentation: Information about the Convertible Reserved Instance offering.

InstanceCount.documentation: The number of instances the Covertible Reserved Instance offering can be applied to. This parameter is reserved and cannot be specified in a request

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target group.

TargetGroupsConfig.documentation: Describes the target groups to attach to a Spot Fleet. Spot Fleet registers the running Spot Instances with these target groups.

ReservationValue.documentation: The total value of the Convertible Reserved Instances that make up the exchange. This is the sum of the list value, remaining upfront price, and additional upfront cost of the exchange.

TargetConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of the Convertible Reserved Instances that make up the exchange.

TargetReservationValue.documentation: The total value of the new Convertible Reserved Instances.

InstanceIds.documentation:
One or more instance IDs.

Constraints: Up to 1000 instance IDs. We recommend breaking up this request into smaller batches.

DryRun.documentation: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation. Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

TerminatingInstances.documentation: Information about one or more terminated instances.

Ipv6Addresses.documentation: The IPv6 addresses to unassign from the network interface.

UnassignedIpv6Addresses.documentation: The IPv6 addresses that have been unassigned from the network interface.

PrivateIpAddresses.documentation: The secondary private IP addresses to unassign from the network interface. You can specify this option multiple times to unassign more than one IP address.

DryRun.documentation: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation. Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

Error.documentation: The applicable error for the T2 or T3 instance whose credit option for CPU usage was not modified.

UnsuccessfulInstanceCreditSpecificationI.documentation: Describes the T2 or T3 instance whose credit option for CPU usage was not modified.
Information about the error for the T2 or T3 instance whose credit option for CPU usage was not modified.

UnsuccessfulItem.documentation: Information about items that were not successfully processed in a batch call.

Message.documentation: The error message accompanying the error code.

UnsuccessfulItemError.documentation: Information about the error that occurred. For more information about errors, see Error Codes.

DryRun.documentation: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation. Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

GroupId.documentation: The ID of the security group. You must specify either the security group ID or the security group name in the request. For security groups in a nondefault VPC, you must specify the security group ID.

GroupName.documentation: [Default VPC] The name of the security group. You must specify either the security group ID or the security group name in the request.

IpPermissions.documentation: The IP permissions for the security group rule.

Return.documentation: Returns true if the request succeeds; otherwise, returns an error.

DryRun.documentation: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation. Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

GroupId.documentation: The ID of the security group. You must specify either the security group ID or the security group name in the request. For security groups in a nondefault VPC, you must specify the security group ID.

GroupName.documentation: [EC2-Classic, default VPC] The name of the security group. You must specify either the security group ID or the security group name in the request.

IpPermissions.documentation: The IP permissions for the security group rule.

Return.documentation: Returns true if the request succeeds; otherwise, returns an error.

S3Bucket.documentation: The name of the S3 bucket where the disk image is located.

S3Key.documentation: The file name of the disk image.

UserBucket.documentation: Describes the S3 bucket for the disk image.

S3Bucket.documentation: The S3 bucket from which the disk image was created.

S3Key.documentation: The file name of the disk image.

UserBucketDetails.documentation: Describes the S3 bucket for the disk image.

Data.documentation: The user data. If you are using an AWS SDK or command line tool, Base64-encoding is performed for you, and you can load the text from a file. Otherwise, you must provide Base64-encoded text.

UserData.documentation: Describes the user data for an instance.

Description.documentation:
A description for the security group rule that references this user ID group pair.

Constraints: Up to 255 characters in length. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, spaces, and ._-:/()#,@[]+=;{}!$*

GroupName.documentation:
The name of the security group. In a request, use this parameter for a security group in EC2-Classic or a default VPC only. For a security group in a nondefault VPC, use the security group ID.

For a referenced security group in another VPC, this value is not returned if the referenced security group is deleted.

PeeringStatus.documentation: The status of a VPC peering connection, if applicable.

UserId.documentation:
The ID of an AWS account.

For a referenced security group in another VPC, the account ID of the referenced security group is returned in the response. If the referenced security group is deleted, this value is not returned.

[EC2-Classic] Required when adding or removing rules that reference a security group in another AWS account.

VpcId.documentation: The ID of the VPC for the referenced security group, if applicable.

VpcPeeringConnectionId.documentation: The ID of the VPC peering connection, if applicable.

UserIdGroupPair.documentation: Describes a security group and AWS account ID pair.

LastStatusChange.documentation: The date and time of the last change in status.

OutsideIpAddress.documentation: The Internet-routable IP address of the virtual private gateway's outside interface.

Status.documentation: The status of the VPN tunnel.

StatusMessage.documentation: If an error occurs, a description of the error.

AvailabilityZone.documentation: The Availability Zone for the volume.

CreateTime.documentation: The time stamp when volume creation was initiated.

Encrypted.documentation: Indicates whether the volume will be encrypted.

KmsKeyId.documentation: The full ARN of the AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) customer master key (CMK) that was used to protect the volume encryption key for the volume.

Size.documentation: The size of the volume, in GiBs.

SnapshotId.documentation: The snapshot from which the volume was created, if applicable.

Iops.documentation:
The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume supports. For Provisioned IOPS SSD volumes, this represents the number of IOPS that are provisioned for the volume. For General Purpose SSD volumes, this represents the baseline performance of the volume and the rate at which the volume accumulates I/O credits for bursting. For more information about General Purpose SSD baseline performance, I/O credits, and bursting, see Amazon EBS Volume Types in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

Constraint: Range is 100-32000 IOPS for io1 volumes and 100-10000 IOPS for gp2 volumes.

Condition: This parameter is required for requests to create io1 volumes; it is not used in requests to create gp2, st1, sc1, or standard volumes.

VolumeType.documentation: The volume type. This can be gp2 for General Purpose SSD, io1 for Provisioned IOPS SSD, st1 for Throughput Optimized HDD, sc1 for Cold HDD, or standard for Magnetic volumes.

AttachTime.documentation: The time stamp when the attachment initiated.

DeleteOnTermination.documentation: Indicates whether the EBS volume is deleted on instance termination.

Size.documentation: The size of the volume, in GiB.

ModificationState.documentation: The current modification state. The modification state is null for unmodified volumes.

StatusMessage.documentation: A status message about the modification progress or failure.

TargetSize.documentation: The target size of the volume, in GiB.

TargetIops.documentation: The target IOPS rate of the volume.

TargetVolumeType.documentation: The target EBS volume type of the volume.

OriginalIops.documentation: The original IOPS rate of the volume.

OriginalVolumeType.documentation: The original EBS volume type of the volume.

Progress.documentation: The modification progress, from 0 to 100 percent complete.

VolumeModification.documentation:
Describes the modification status of an EBS volume.

If the volume has never been modified, some element values will be null.

Code.documentation: The code identifying the operation, for example, enable-volume-io.

EventId.documentation: The ID of the event associated with this operation.

EventType.documentation: The event type associated with this operation.

Status.documentation: The intended status of the volume status.

NotAfter.documentation: The latest end time of the event.

NotBefore.documentation: The earliest start time of the event.

Status.documentation: The status of the volume.

AvailabilityZone.documentation: The Availability Zone of the volume.

Events.documentation: A list of events associated with the volume.

CidrBlock.documentation: The primary IPv4 CIDR block for the VPC.

DhcpOptionsId.documentation: The ID of the set of DHCP options you've associated with the VPC (or default if the default options are associated with the VPC).

InstanceTenancy.documentation: The allowed tenancy of instances launched into the VPC.

Ipv6CidrBlockAssociationSet.documentation: Information about the IPv6 CIDR blocks associated with the VPC.

CidrBlockAssociationSet.documentation: Information about the IPv4 CIDR blocks associated with the VPC.

IsDefault.documentation: Indicates whether the VPC is the default VPC.

VpcAttachment.documentation: Describes an attachment between a virtual private gateway and a VPC.

AssociationId.documentation: The association ID for the IPv4 CIDR block.

CidrBlockState.documentation: Information about the state of the CIDR block.

VpcCidrBlockAssociation.documentation: Describes an IPv4 CIDR block associated with a VPC.

StatusMessage.documentation: A message about the status of the CIDR block, if applicable.

VpcCidrBlockState.documentation: Describes the state of a CIDR block.

ClassicLinkEnabled.documentation: Indicates whether the VPC is enabled for ClassicLink.

VpcClassicLink.documentation: Describes whether a VPC is enabled for ClassicLink.

VpcId.documentation: The ID of the VPC to which the endpoint is associated.

ServiceName.documentation: The name of the service to which the endpoint is associated.

PolicyDocument.documentation: The policy document associated with the endpoint, if applicable.

RouteTableIds.documentation: (Gateway endpoint) One or more route tables associated with the endpoint.

SubnetIds.documentation: (Interface endpoint) One or more subnets in which the endpoint is located.

Groups.documentation: (Interface endpoint) Information about the security groups associated with the network interface.

PrivateDnsEnabled.documentation: (Interface endpoint) Indicates whether the VPC is associated with a private hosted zone.

NetworkInterfaceIds.documentation: (Interface endpoint) One or more network interfaces for the endpoint.

DnsEntries.documentation: (Interface endpoint) The DNS entries for the endpoint.

CreationTimestamp.documentation: The date and time the VPC endpoint was created.

ServiceId.documentation: The ID of the service to which the endpoint is connected.

VpcEndpointOwner.documentation: The AWS account ID of the owner of the VPC endpoint.

CreationTimestamp.documentation: The date and time the VPC endpoint was created.

VpcEndpointConnection.documentation: Describes a VPC endpoint connection to a service.

AssociationId.documentation: The association ID for the IPv6 CIDR block.

Ipv6CidrBlockState.documentation: Information about the state of the CIDR block.

VpcIpv6CidrBlockAssociation.documentation: Describes an IPv6 CIDR block associated with a VPC.

AccepterVpcInfo.documentation: Information about the accepter VPC. CIDR block information is only returned when describing an active VPC peering connection.

ExpirationTime.documentation: The time that an unaccepted VPC peering connection will expire.

RequesterVpcInfo.documentation: Information about the requester VPC. CIDR block information is only returned when describing an active VPC peering connection.

Status.documentation: The status of the VPC peering connection.

VpcPeeringConnectionId.documentation: The ID of the VPC peering connection.

AllowDnsResolutionFromRemoteVpc.documentation: Indicates whether a local VPC can resolve public DNS hostnames to private IP addresses when queried from instances in a peer VPC.

AllowEgressFromLocalClassicLinkToRemoteV.documentation: Indicates whether a local ClassicLink connection can communicate with the peer VPC over the VPC peering connection.

AllowEgressFromLocalVpcToRemoteClassicLi.documentation: Indicates whether a local VPC can communicate with a ClassicLink connection in the peer VPC over the VPC peering connection.

Code.documentation: The status of the VPC peering connection.

Message.documentation: A message that provides more information about the status, if applicable.

VpcPeeringConnectionStateReason.documentation: Describes the status of a VPC peering connection.

CidrBlock.documentation: The IPv4 CIDR block for the VPC.

Ipv6CidrBlockSet.documentation: The IPv6 CIDR block for the VPC.

CidrBlockSet.documentation: Information about the IPv4 CIDR blocks for the VPC.

OwnerId.documentation: The AWS account ID of the VPC owner.

PeeringOptions.documentation: Information about the VPC peering connection options for the accepter or requester VPC.

Region.documentation: The region in which the VPC is located.

VpcPeeringConnectionVpcInfo.documentation: Describes a VPC in a VPC peering connection.

CustomerGatewayConfiguration.documentation: The configuration information for the VPN connection's customer gateway (in the native XML format). This element is always present in the CreateVpnConnection response; however, it's present in the DescribeVpnConnections response only if the VPN connection is in the pending or available state.

CustomerGatewayId.documentation: The ID of the customer gateway at your end of the VPN connection.

Category.documentation: The category of the VPN connection. A value of VPN indicates an AWS VPN connection. A value of VPN-Classic indicates an AWS Classic VPN connection. For more information, see AWS Managed VPN Categories in the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud User Guide.

State.documentation: The current state of the VPN connection.

VpnGatewayId.documentation: The ID of the virtual private gateway at the AWS side of the VPN connection.

Routes.documentation: The static routes associated with the VPN connection.

Tags.documentation: Any tags assigned to the VPN connection.

StaticRoutesOnly.documentation: Indicates whether the VPN connection uses static routes only. Static routes must be used for devices that don't support BGP.

Indicate whether the VPN connection uses static routes only. If you are creating a VPN connection for a device that does not support BGP, you must specify true. Use CreateVpnConnectionRoute to create a static route.

Default: false

TunnelOptions.documentation: The tunnel options for the VPN connection.

AvailabilityZone.documentation: The Availability Zone where the virtual private gateway was created, if applicable. This field may be empty or not returned.

State.documentation: The current state of the virtual private gateway.

Type.documentation: The type of VPN connection the virtual private gateway supports.

VpcAttachments.documentation: Any VPCs attached to the virtual private gateway.

VpnGatewayId.documentation: The ID of the virtual private gateway.

AmazonSideAsn.documentation: The private Autonomous System Number (ASN) for the Amazon side of a BGP session.

Tags.documentation: Any tags assigned to the virtual private gateway.

DestinationCidrBlock.documentation: The CIDR block associated with the local subnet of the customer data center.

State.documentation: The current state of the static route.

VpnStaticRoute.documentation: Describes a static route for a VPN connection.

TunnelInsideCidr.documentation:
The range of inside IP addresses for the tunnel. Any specified CIDR blocks must be unique across all VPN connections that use the same virtual private gateway.

Constraints: A size /30 CIDR block from the 169.254.0.0/16 range. The following CIDR blocks are reserved and cannot be used:

  • 169.254.0.0/30

  • 169.254.1.0/30

  • 169.254.2.0/30

  • 169.254.3.0/30

  • 169.254.4.0/30

  • 169.254.5.0/30

  • 169.254.169.252/30

PreSharedKey.documentation:
The pre-shared key (PSK) to establish initial authentication between the virtual private gateway and customer gateway.

Constraints: Allowed characters are alphanumeric characters and ._. Must be between 8 and 64 characters in length and cannot start with zero (0).

VpnTunnelOptionsSpecification.documentation: The tunnel options for a VPN connection.

Cidr.documentation: The public IPv4 address range, in CIDR notation.

DryRun.documentation: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation. Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

documentation:
Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud

Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) provides secure and resizable computing capacity in the AWS cloud. Using Amazon EC2 eliminates the need to invest in hardware up front, so you can develop and deploy applications faster.

To learn more about Amazon EC2, Amazon EBS, and Amazon VPC, see the following resources:

  • Amazon EC2 product page

  • Amazon EC2 documentation

  • Amazon EBS product page

  • Amazon VPC product page

  • Amazon VPC documentation
